column1: full outside off, swinging away, and he pierces the cover field with impeccable timing
full outside off, driven firmly to cover-point
length outside off, defended to cover-point. The ball's sliding onto the bat nicely here
length outside off, slashed straight to point, that's a missed opportunity with the width on offer
length on middle, slight movement back in, cramps him for room, defended back to the bowler
length on middle, touch of movement away, defended to point, but sloppy work there allows Akmal to retain strike with a single
length on middle, sliding back in, tentatively pushes and gets an inside edge to short fine
swing and a miss. It was tossed up, angled into his body, Akmal went for the slog sweep but beaten all ends
full on off, gets off the mark by dancing down the wicket and pushing it to long-off
quicker one, Akmal makes room and plays back, deceived by the flatter trajectory and is beaten again
length outside off and an extension of the arms for Akmal takes the ball sailing over the deep cover fence for the first six of the innings. That was hit hard and flat
full and angled in, gets an inside edge onto his pad
ugly hoick, he misses as the ball skids through, there's a massive appeal and given!. Fletcher reviews but in vain as that would have crashed into leg stump.
length on off, shuffles across and defends
length outside off, defended solidly to cover
length outside off, punched to point
length outside off, predictable line and length, and he lofts him over mid-off to regain some momentum
length on middle, goes for the pull, too early into the stroke, gets an inside edge back onto his body as it trickles away to squareleg
length, angled across, inside edge back onto his body
length on middle, picks it up to deep squareleg but there's protection on the boundary
length outside off, slower ball, steered to third-man
length on middle, clipped straight to midwicket
length outside off and he throws his hands at it to loft it over the deep cover for another six in that region
slower ball but too much width and Akmal pounces on it with the cut shot that goes screaming past point for four
length on middle, Akmal swings to early and gets an inside edge back on to his body
down the wicket and the length ball outside off has been sliced over point for another four
length on the pads, Akmal misses the flick and is struck on the thigh pad, as the ball trickles away to the leg side
slower ball outside off, in Akmal's strong zone again but steered to third-man only for one
length outside off, defended to point
length on off, opens the face and steers it delicately late past point
length on middle, cramping him for room, the right tactic, defended back to the bowler
length on middle, uses the angle to pick it up to deep squareleg but there's protection
length outside off, steered to point
length outside off, pushed to cover-point
length on middle, backs away to blast it through the covers but there's not timing
googly to start with but poor line as it slides down the leg side
tossed up on off, lunges forward, opens the face to place it to the right of point
another googly on a length, sharp turn back in as Akmal made room and was caught in an awkward position as he steered it to short third-man
full on middle, pushed to midwicket
length on middle, pushed to midwicket
another googly, spinning back in from outside off, he picks it off the pitch and pushes it down to long-on
tossed up outside off, bit of turn and beats Akmal, who has a tentative prod at it
length on middle, pushed back
quicker one, angled in, he skips down and defends to cover
tossed up on off, skips down the wicket, chooses to defend again
full on middle and he gets under it and lofts him straight down the ground. Right in the slot
length on middle, whipped away to long-on off the backfoot
dropped! He came dancing down the wicket, couldn't quite get under it but hammered it hard and flat straight to long-off who couldn't latch on
full on middle and out comes the slog-sweep to start the over with a massive six and rub salt into the wounds of the opposition after he'd just been dropped on the long-off fence
googly, on a length, Akmal picks it, rocks back and bisects short third-man and point with a delicate cut shot that races away to the fence
full outside off and Akmal has really taken a liking to the legspinner, who has nowhere to run as he is lofted over deep cover for six this time
length on middle, skips down the wicket, swings too soon and gets an inside edge to the keeper
full on middle, pushed to long-on
slower ball outside off, tries to steer it to third-man but misses
full, angled in, whipped away to deep midwicket
slower ball from the back off the hand, Akmal lunges forwards, opens the face and is beaten
yorker on middle, squirts it past point for one
length outside off, too much width, Akmal hammers it over the outstretched fingers of the cover fielder and the power behind the stroke takes it to the fence
length outside off, he goes inside out again, perhaps meant to go straighter, ended up slicing it to deep extra-cover, who ran in a few paces and latched on comfortably
length outside off, quicker one, Misbah brings his bat down in time to steer it to point
length outside off, Misbah skips down the wicket and defends it in time-honoured fashion, with his bat tucked behind the pad. He was way outside the line
full on middle, tucked away to squareleg
length on middle, defended back to the bowler
googly, full on middle, swept away to short fine-leg
length outside off, hint of turn away, pushed to deep cover
straighter one on middle, pushed back to the bowler
googly outside off, spins back in, Misbah whips it away to long-on
length on off, bit of turn, pushed to cover
full on off, it was a googly again and Misbah was waiting for it as he went down on one knee, got under it and launched it over deep midwicket
yorker outside off, can't jam his bat down on it

slower ball on middle, massive appeal, as the batsman shuffles across, swings to the leg side and misses. Looked very very close. Reviewed immediately after it was turned down originally. He was struck in line, there was no bat. Would the angle have taken it past leg stump? Ball tracking confirms that's exactly what it would have done
full on middle, swings with his feet rooted to the crease, weight entirely on the backfoot, and ends up slicing it  straight down deep cover's throat
length outside off, steered to third-man
length on off, Pollard skips down the wicket and tucks it away to squareleg. Good first ball, hurried on to Pollard
length outside off, steered to point, there's a misfield, which allows a single
length on off, spinning away, Misbah rocks back and drags the pull to deep midwicket, all along the ground
full outside off, Pollard has a poke and misses
Pollard skips down the wicket, the bowler cleverly shortens his length and deceives the batsman completely but Pollard had the presence of mind to change his shot and push it past cover
length outside off, attempted reverse sweep but straight to short third-man
full outside off, pushed to long-off
length outside off, rides the bounce and steers it to third-man
length, angled in, whipped away to deep squareleg
full on off, shuffles across and pushes it to long-on
length, angled in, Pollard is struck on the pad as he misses the flick but it would have missed leg stump by a mile
short ball, follows Misbah, who was trying to back away, ducks under as an afterthought
full outside off, skips down the wicket and squeezes it away to deep cover
length, angled in, goes for the slog sweep but doesn't get hold of it, couple of bounces to deep squareleg
length on middle, Pollard back away and tries to loft him down the ground, with his weight too far back, he was cramped for room as well and all that results in him holing out to long-off
length on off, pushed to deep extra cover

appeal and given. It was a phenomenal first ball to Dawson, bit of drift into leg stump and sharp turn away after it pitched, beat him as he closed the face off the bat and struck him plumb in front. But they review and it looks like it may have pitched outside leg. Just about and Dawson survives after deciding to review
quicker one, angled in, backs away and opens the face to steer it to point
length outside off, slashes and misses
length on the pads, clipped to deep squareleg
length on middle, and Misbah rocks back, rolls his wrists, picking it up to the right of deep squareleg for four
length on the pads, Misbah unable to tickle it past short-fine
yorker on middle, jams his bat down on it to squeeze it to long-on
length on middle and this time he has no intention of keeping it down, picking him up over the deep squareleg. Hit flat and hard
yorker on middle, squeezed to long-on
slower ball on middle, held up in the pitch a little, Misbah pushes it to deep midwicket
yorker on off, pushed to long-off
full toss and hammered down the ground but straight to long-on
slower ball, rocks back and swings to deep squareleg
full on off, and that's classy batting as he squeezes it past point for four
slower ball on middle, out comes the slog sweep, couple of bounces down to deep midwicket
yorker on leg stump, squeezes it down to fine-leg off the inside edge
yorker outside off, makes room and digs it out to point
full outside off, squeezed to third-man off the outside edge
short ball, Misbah shuffles across and pulls it past short fine-leg, but the there was no power behind the stroke which means that the deep squareleg can cut it off
yorker on leg stump and that's very unlucky for the bowler, as he squeezes it away off the inside edge down to the fine leg fence
full toss on middle, Misbah swings to the leg side but can't get much power or elevation
brilliant batting! Predicted the full length and waited to scoop it over the short fine-leg
full outside off, skips down the wicket and pushes it cover
length outside off, Misbah shuffles across and ramps it over the keeper, and it nearly goes for six but he'll take the boundary
full on middle, Misbah back away and creams it through the covers to raise the fifty of the partnership
yorker on middle, Misbah squeezes it out to point to finish unbeaten on 49
wicket first ball! Length, nipped back in sharply to strike him plumb in front as it skidded through and the batsman seemed to know his fate as soon as he missed that
length on middle, defended off the backfoot
length outside off, pushes it to cover
length outside off and swatted past the bowler to get the chase under way. Brutal stroke!
full on the pads, clipped through midwicket and the timing is sublime as it races across the turf
length outside off, an air of over confidence in that attempted pull nearly led to his demise but the inside edge went past the stumps and down to fine-leg
full on middle, pushed back to the bowler
full on off, Watson, hanging back is slightly late on it but gets his bat down in time and squeezes it away for a single to point
length on off and muscled down the ground for another boundary
full on middle, pushed to long-on
length on middle, a more confident push from Watson but he was hanging back again
short and Watson pulls it hard across the turf to deep squareleg
length on off, squeezed down to the right of third-man off a thick outside edge
length on middle, pushed back to the bowler
length on middle, Watson defends hanging back again
length on middle, hurries on to him as he tries to pull
length on middle, another attempted pull, miscued aerially to deep squereleg off a thick inside edge
length on middle, tucked away to short fine-leg
length outside off, pushed to point
short on middle and Watson finally connects with the pull, picking it up wide of deep squereleg there and it carries over the fence
short outside off, uses the pace and the width and lifts it over point
full on off and Watson's found his zone here. Keeps his shape, goes through the line and blasts it over mid-off
slower ball, Watson swings but swings too soon and is beaten comprehensively

slower ball on middle, Watson attempts the same stroke again, connects this time but gets it off the toe of the bat as he was way too early into the shot, skies it to long-on, who takes it comfortably
full on middle, clipped to midwicket
full outside off, he shuffles across and throws his hands at it and clears the long-off fence with ease
down the wicket, the bowler adjusts his length, drags it back and Akmal misses the ugly swing to the leg side
length on off, nips back in sharply and goes right through him
length outside off and he uses the pace and the width to cleverly bisect point and short third-man with an open face
length on off, defended with soft hands and they scamper one
dances down the wicket and smokes it over the long-on fence with nothing but a flick of the wrists
slower ball on middle, pushed wide of cover for one
length on middle, gets an inside edge back onto his back thigh and they scamper one
high full toss, waited for it and steered it to point
length on middle, squeezed to deep squareleg off a thick inside edge

slower ball, Akmal lunges forward and pushes at it, gets an outside edge to a tumbling short third-man, who can't get his hands under it or prevent the boundary. Fell well short, actually, but he was unsure whether to go for the catch or stop the boundary, ended up doing neither
full on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
length outside off, defended to point
full outside off, crisply driven to mid-off
length outside off, Akmal is beaten as he tries to steer it to third-man. Was late on it, Akmal
length outside off and beaten by pace again
full outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
length on middle, pushed back to the bowler
down the wicket, the bowler adjusts well, shortens the length, deceiving the batsman, who also does well to change the shot he was initially shaping to play, steering it past point
full outside off and hammered over extra cover
short and Akmal was waiting for that, as he rocked back and pulled it between deep midwicket and long-on
length on middle, pushed to deep midwicket
yorker on middle, tailing back in slightly, squeezed back to the bowler

length outside off, swatted flat and hard but straight to mid-off. That's slightly unlucky for the batsman, as that shot had been a loyal ally for most of this innings. Timely wicket for Peshawar Zalmi
length outside off, steered to third-man
length outside off, Sarfaraz chases it and is beaten
full outside off, crisply dirven to cover
length outside and steered past the keeper delicately late down to third-man for four
length, angled in, clipped to deep squareleg
full on middle, charges down the wicket and gets an inside edge back on to his pad
short ball, Sarfaraz pulls and gets it down to fine-leg
length outside off, steered to third-man
length, angled in, Akmal rocks back and whips it away to deep midwicket, they turn for the second and Sarfaraz had to hurry there
full and angled in, squeezed to squereleg off a thick inside edge
full on middle, defended
full on middle, goes down on one knee to sweep it fine and along the ground for four
length on off, pushed to deep cover
quicker one on middle as he sees Akmal charging down the wicket but the batsman, well set now, adjusts and pushes it safely to cover-pint
length on middle, skids onto Sarfaraz, gets an inside edge as it thuds into his pads
full outside off, pushed to deep cover and there's an immediate call for two, which they make with ease
full on middle, pushed to mid-on
yorker, hint of tail back in, Sarfaraz squeezes it out, they scamper a single even as there's a direct hit
full on middle, pushed to cover
length on middle, a bit of impatience from Akmal as he swings wildly to the leg side but in the end, gets a thick inside edge that beats fine-leg to his left
length outside off, slower ball, Sarfaraz too early into the pull and misses
full toss, tailing in, Sarfaraz misses the flick and the umpire raises the finger immediately. Sarfaraz reviews. Looks to sliding down by a long long way, and ball tracking confirms
length on off, he shuffles across and picks it up past the airborne midwicket fielder and into the boundary to bring up the hundred
length on middle, clipped away to deep squareleg
length on off, defended with soft hands and they scamper one
full on middle, tailing in, Sarfaraz squeezes it to short fine-leg off the inside edge
length outside off, steered to short third-man, Sarfaraz calls Akmal through for a risky run and a direct hit would have had him at the non striker
length outside off and carved wide past the diving point fielder
short outside off and hammered flat and hard to deep point
length on middle, pushed between deep midwicket and long-on and they are doing this very smartly

length on middle, pushed to long-on, the fielder comes charging in as the batsmen look for two again, the throw is hurled at the keeper's end, a little wide, but Kamran does excellently to collect it and flick it back on to the stumps. However, Sarfaraz survives by the skin of his teeth
length on leg stump, helped along to deep squareleg
length on off, defended to cover, they scamper another tight single
full outside off, driven to cover, there's a fumble, some hesitation with running again but they decide against it
length outside off, defended with soft hands and they come through for a run
length outside off and he has slapped that long and hard over the long-off fence
length on off, steered to point
length on middle, swung away to the leg side and a thick inside edge earns Umar Akmal a boundary to deep squareleg that brings up his fifty
length on middle, swung away to deep midwicket this time, there wasn't much timing so they get a couple
full outside off, lofts it over mid-off, who gives chase and retrieves with an awkward slide
full on off, pushed to cover
full on off, pushed to mid-off and they come through for one
short ball, hurries on to him a little, but manages to help it along to fine-leg for one
length outside off, sliced over point
length, angled in, helped along to the right of deep squareleg
full outside off, nails the drive to cover but aerially and Sammy latches on to it comfortably
yorker from wide off the crease, outside off, can't jam his bat down on it
another yorker, angled in, steered to third-man this time
length on middle, pushed to deep midwicket
length outside off, steered to point
length outside off, slower ball, Umar Akmal jumps down the wicket and is beaten by a long way
yorker on off, squeezes it out
length on off, spotted the slower ball and swatted it past midwicket and it raced to the fence to release the pressure that had built over the last few balls
full toss, pushed back to the bowler
full outside off, almost a yorker but Umar Akmal manages to not only bring his bat down on out but also pierce the cover field
length outside off, punched to cover
short ball and Dwayne Smith whips it off his hip with immense power down to the deep squareleg fence
full on off, yorker length, Smith squeezes it between his legs and down to fine-leg
slower ball, length outside off, steered to third-man
short ball, Smith wants to duck under it, doesn't get low enough and the ball doesn't rise high enough resulting in a blow to his shoulder
length on middle, pushed to cover
length on middle, defended back to the bowler
full on middle, squeezed to long-on to level the scores
finishes it off in style, with a massive six over deep mid-wicket after having curbed his attacking instincts through the middle stages. That's the match, a fairly convincing win for the Gladiators
